result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant Brandon T Aide in court.  Attorney Theresa L Lewandowski in court for State of Wisconsin. In court today for a hearing regarding pro se speedy trial demand in the 3 felony cases. DE is pro se, but does qualify for SPD. Court orders the State to provide a global resolution to the DE in writing in 2 weeks.
Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Copy of minutes from BBH Hrg on 9/23/22 and bond form sent electronically to DCJ.

Court reporter Tara Monthie. Defendant Brandon T Aide in court, in custody.  Attorney Shaun W O'Connell in court for Brandon T Aide.  Attorney Carl Lazarus in court for State of Wisconsin. In court today for a bail hearing in cases 22CF1842 and 22CF1855 as requested by the defense. Atty O'Connell gives argument. State objects to modification and gives argument. Court makes findings and will reduce cash bail as follows: in 22CF1842 cash bail is reduced to $500.00 and in 22CF1855 cash bail is reduced to $1,500. ALL OTHER BAIL CONDITIONS WILL REMAIN THE SAME IN BOTH CASES.
Status conference on September 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:48 AM Defendant Brandon T Aide in court, in custody.  Attorney Shaun W O'Connell in court for Brandon T Aide.  Attorney Timothy Verhoff for Thersa Louise Lewandowski in court for State of Wisconsin. T Francis, MAPD, duly sworn & testified. Direct exam by ADA Verhoff. Witness ID'd DE. Cross by Atty O'Connell. Re-direct by ADA Verhoff. Witness excused. No further witnesses. ADA moves for bindover, reserves argument. Atty O'Connell objects & waives argument.  CT finds probable cause & grants bindover.

03:04 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Diana Maria Van Rybroek.  Thersa Louise Lewandowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 10:30 am.
